item.title: ISIS video claims beheading of British hostage David Haines
item.description: The Islamic State in Iraq and Syria released a video that showed what appeared to be the beheading of a British citizen, David Cawthorne Haines, an aid worker.

item.title: Lust for seats can snap alliance, Sena warns BJP, cancels seat-sharing talks
item.description: An editorial in the Sena's Saamna using a risque metaphor to chide the partyâ€™s allies for asking for too many assembly seats has triggered fresh tension in the Sena-BJP alliance.

item.title: Jumping a red light may soon cost you Rs 5,000; cellphone use Rs 4,000
item.description: The draft Bill, which was posted online for public comments, also proposes high penalty of Rs 5 lakh on automobile companies who release faulty vehicles into the market.

item.title: Home ministry denies Chinese students nod to visit Kochi shipyard and refinery plant
item.description: The 100-member team, whose itinerary included a visit to the Cochin Shipyard Limited and Kochi Refineries Ltd, was denied permission by the home ministry citing sensitivity of these installations.

item.title: Lahore Lions embarrass Mumbai Indians in CLT20 qualifiers
